Owlhawk listened to this, but his curiosity grew about
one thing.

Owlhawk:  But beating my commander in a fight would
simply prove I can beat him one on one, what would it
prove in terms of who is most capable of planning our
battle strategies?

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Katya realized what she had forgotten to tell him.
> 
> Katya: You are right about the challenge. Should you
> win, you would 
> prove that you are a better warrior than your
> officer, thus proving 
> him wrong.
> 
> She paused, then started moving back to the base.
> She waved him to 
> follow.
> 
> Katya: Now about the Kerenskys... They are the
> founders of all Clans, 
> the makers of our society and one of the most, if
> not the most revered 
> Bloodline among all Clans. Some of us maintain that
> our duty as 
> Warriors is to protect the Inner Sphere. We oppose
> the Crusaders 
> saying it is a desecrated place and that it deserves
> only to be 
> conquered and brought back up into a stronger Clan
> society. It is all 
> interpretation of the words of Nicholas Kerensky,
> the first Ilkhan, 
> and it has led many to die, both among and outside
> the Clans.
> 
> She closed her eyes remembered all too well the two
> days she had spent 
> evading the massive ComGuard battlemechs at the
> Great battle of 
> Tukkayid. She had seen friends die there, and she
> felt that it was 
> foolish for such a waste as the invasion.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > Owlhawk:  I assume it means to challenge him in
> > combat, but I don't know who Kerensky is.
> > 
> > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Katya glared at the bot straight in his eyes.
> > > 
> > > Katya: Noble intention about the animals, but
> > > following orders is not 
> > > the only thing that makes a warrior. Remember, I
> > > told you that we 
> > > abhor waste. Destroying a forest is the kind of
> > > thing that debalances 
> > > a world's environment needlessly. A military
> > > compound can be built on 
> > > rock farther away. In that situation, when you
> feel
> > > your officer's 
> > > orders betray the spirits of Kerensky, you can
> and
> > > youmust challenge 
> > > him to a Trial. Do you understand what that
> means,
> > > quiaff?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > Owlhawk:  I do as I was ordered without
> question,
> > > > perhaps making a loud noice to give the
> animals a
> > > head
> > > > start on the fire.
> > > > 
> > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > She came nearer to him. She was not
> > > instinctively
> > > > > harsh or cruel, but 
> > > > > her tone showed that she was to be listened
> to.
> > > > > Owlhawk may be a 
> > > > > warrior, but she was more. She was a Wolf
> > > Warrior,
> > > > > and she had to 
> > > > > break him from the tactics and habits he was
> > > used to
> > > > > make him into 
> > > > > something more.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: Neg. A Clan warrior that is not
> prepared,
> > > > > mentally or 
> > > > > physically is as good as the freebirth scum
> > > > > populating the bandit 
> > > > > caste. You must learn to be ready at all
> times.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She eased her tone. She had rebuked him, and
> now
> > > was
> > > > > the time to 
> > > > > instruct him.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: The Clan rituals have two goals; the
> > > first
> > > > > one is honor. The 
> > > > > forces meeting in a Trial meet in a circle
> of
> > > > > equals. This way, we 
> > > > > fight zellbringen, single combat. I admit
> that
> > > > > necessity may prevent 
> > > > > us from always achieving single combat, but
> > > honor
> > > > > does not diminish 
> > > > > this way. The second reason for Trials is
> that
> > > it
> > > > > prevents waste. The 
> > > > > Clans have survived their birthing because
> they
> > > > > reduced wastes of 
> > > > > all kind to a minimum. Remember that. Now...
> > > What do
> > > > > you do if a 
> > > > > superior gives an order to raze a forest to
> make
> > > > > more place for a 
> > > > > military compound?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > OOC:  Sorry I thought they were going to
> wait
> > > > > until
> > > > > > they talked to Rodimus.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > BIC:  Owlhawk moved over and stood at
> > > attention in
> > > > > > front of her.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Owlhawk:  I assume to prepare your warrior
> > > both
> > > > > > mentally and physically for combat.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> wrote:
> > > > > > > Katya: What are you doing, you freebirth
> > > slag?
> > > > > Move
> > > > > > > your circuits over 
> > > > > > > here! Tell me why you think ritual
> trials
> > > are
> > > > > > > important to us.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > Owlhawk was under the impression the
> > > > > conversation
> > > > > > > was
> > > > > > > > over and just leaned against the wall.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- warriorazure
> <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Katya seemed happy of the decision.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Katya: Good. I will speak with
> Rodimus
> > > about
> > > > > > > this.
> > > > > > > > > If he does not want 
> > > > > > > > > me to train you, I will challenge
> him to
> > > a
> > > > > more
> > > > > > > > > serious trial.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > She waited for Owlhawk's reaction.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > Owlhawk:  Allow me a moment to
> answer
> > > > > that.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > He once again goes inside his mind
> to
> > > > > speak
> > > > > > > with
> > > > > > > > > Owl.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > Hawk:  What do you think?
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > Owl:  Well, it might be refreshing
> to
> > > look
> > > > > at
> 
=== message truncated ===
